qas.question: What is the per capita GDP of Cyprus given by the IMF?
Why has Cyprus been sought out by offshore businesses?
What are three of the largest contributors to the Cyprus economy?
When was the Euro declared as the national currency of Cyprus?

context: According to the latest International Monetary Fund estimates, its per capita GDP (adjusted for purchasing power) at <a0_0>$30,769<a0_0/> is just above the average of the European Union.[citation needed] Cyprus has been sought as a base for several offshore businesses for its <a1_0>low tax rates<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Tourism, financial services and shipping<a2_0/> are significant parts of the economy. Economic policy of the Cyprus government has focused on meeting the criteria for admission to the European Union. The Cypriot government adopted the euro as the national currency on <a3_0>1 January 2008<a3_0/>.
